name: Regent Taipei

reviews.title: Go for the Taipan Floor
reviews.text: This is a really classy hotel. Good location, great hardware, competent and courteous staff. The only negative thing about this hotel is that it has a big shopping mall , which makes the lobby pretty crowded at times. Another negative is the lack of a proper bar at the hotel.

When staying here, do check the prices for the Taipan (Executive Floor) package. The premium is usually quite small (around US$20-30), and for that price you get a great big room in the top floors, LCD TVs in the room and in the bathroom, fabulous service, a premium (but limited) breakfast, free liquor and snacks in the evenings, free meeting room, free internet, various other goodies. And if you are on business, you won't find a better place than the club lounge to entertain your guests. Well worth the upgrade!
reviews.title: "This hotel doesn't define the definition of five star."
Very nice sleep
reviews.text: I haven't had time to go to the spa, but i hear it's very good. The location is downtown, but entertainment options in this area are limited and are mostly geared towards the Japanese, but if you are willing to travel 15 minutes by taxi, you can get pretty much anywhere.

reviews.title: Nonsmokers beware
reviews.text: This is of course not a cheap hotel, but Taipei itself is expensive and this hotel is not much pricier than Hyatt, Sheraton, Landis, etc. and a whole lot better than the next category of hotels which are $50 or so less. I think this is much better bang for your buck, especially if you use all the facilities.

reviews.title: 5-Star hotel refuses to provide hair conditioner
reviews.text: I stayed in the Grand Formosa Regent Taipei on July 20, 2005. However, I was displeased by the "quality" of the room. When I reserved the room, I requested a room to be on a non-smoking floor. The reservation staff told me that it would not be a problem. HOWEVER, when I went into the room, the room was filled will smoke. I called and requested to have my room changed. They did change my room, however I was disappointed with the room! The room was spacious, however it was old and glommy! There are hardly any lights in the room. The TV was extremely small (I think it is only 7 inch) and the TV wasn't functioning well either. Their marble bath was spacious, BUT conditioner was not provided in the room!

reviews.title: Will not recommend
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Formosa Regent Taipei from March 30 through April 6 2005. The room we had was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel staff(with the exception of one concierge staff), were all friendly and eager to please.

reviews.title: Best in Taipei - Will not disappoint
reviews.text: 'Timmy' is the name shown on his name tag ..... He is the rudest and most undignified staff member we have ever met at a 5 star hotel.

description: Regent Taipei has 538 of the most spacious and attractively designed rooms in Taiwan. Standard amenities include the pressure relieving Wellspring Bed, a pillow menu, feather duvet, large marbled bathroom with deep soaking tub and separate shower, 24-hour room service, complimentary wireless Internet, satellite TV, stereo, in-room safe, and mini-bar. On the top floors of Regent Taipei is TAI PAN Residence & Club, an all-butler hotel that coalesces the traditional Oriental milieu with contemporary comfort, where one can Experience Modern Chinese Lifestyle. Also found in the hotel are the Wellspring Spa urban resort, the state-of-the-art Health Club & Sauna, complete meeting and banqueting facilities, a rooftop pool, the Regent Galleria that provides a world-class shopping venue to cater to the needs of global luxury travelers, and eight world-class restaurants that offer traditional and innovative cuisines.
